mocap.commands.recording.start.player_no: Add nickname to command or execute it as a player
mocap.commands.recording.start.waiting_f: Take any action or use "/mocap recording start" again to start recording...
mocap.commands.recording.start.different: §lError:§r "/mocap recording start" executed again with different input player!
You can use "/mocap recording stop" and then try again to start recording
mocap.commands.recording.stop.waiting_fo:
Recording stopped - waiting for decision...
Use "/mocap recording save <recording_name>" to save it
or "/mocap recording stop" to discard it.
mocap.commands.recording.save.nothing_to: You need to start recording first
mocap.commands.recording.save.waiting_fo: To start recording take any action or use "/mocap recording start" again
mocap.commands.recording.save.recording_: To save recording you need to first stop it using "/mocap recording stop"
mocap.commands.recording.save.file_alrea: Recording with this name may already exist
mocap.commands.scenes.add_to.error: §lError:§r unable to add element to scene!
mocap.commands.scenes.add_to.error.file_: Scene with this name doesn't exist
mocap.commands.scenes.add_to.error.too_l: Maximum length of a player's name is 16
mocap.commands.scenes.remove_from.error: §lError:§r unable to remove element from scene!
Scene with this name doesn't exist
Element with the given number doesn't exist
Use "/mocap scenes listElements [scene]" to get element numbers
mocap.commands.playing.stop.unable_to_fi: §lError:§r unable to find scene with given id!
Use "/mocap playing list" to get list of all currently played scenes
mocap.commands.settings.info.name: §lName:§r %s
mocap.commands.settings.info.about.playi: §lAbout:§r Allows you to change speed of played recording or scene
mocap.commands.settings.info.about.recor: §lAbout:§r Makes recording of complex scenes easier by synchronizing start of played scene with start of recording
mocap.commands.help:
%s - §lHelp§r
  /mocap recording [...] - Recording player movements
  /mocap scenes [...] - Creating and modifying scenes
  /mocap playing [...] - Playing scens and recordings
  /mocap settings [...] - Shows and modifies settings
  /mocap info - Displays information about mod
  /mocap help - Displays this message
§lHow to use:§r
- First, you need to start recording using "/mocap recording start". It will record all your movements or movements of a player given as an argument. 
- Then, you can stop recording using "/mocap recording stop" and save it with "/mocap recording save <name>".
- Use "/mocap playing start <name>" to play recording.
- You can also create scenes to which you can add multiple recordings or other scenes, with parameters like player name, position offset, or start delay.
- To create scene use "/mocap scenes add <scene_name>". Then, add your recording using "/mocap scenes addTo <scene_name> <recording_name> [delay] [x_offset] [y_offset] [z_offset] [player_name]" (you can skip arguments in square brackets if you want).
- To play scene use "/mocap playing start .<scene_name>" - you need to put a dot before the scene name.
- By putting a dot before name, when using "/mocap scenes addTo ...", you can also add scenes to other scenes.
mocap.commands.error.improper_name.chara: You can only use lowercase letters, numbers, an underscore, a dash, or a dot
mocap.commands.error.improper_name.dot_f: You can't use a dot as a first character
